proposition: When it comes to the decision of whether to train while sick, it is essential to prioritize health and well-being above all else.
The belief that pushing through a workout while feeling under the weather may help boost the immune system or maintain fitness levels is a common misconception in the fitness community.
Training when sick can often do more harm than good.
The text discusses the approach of the author.
The author opts to err on the side of caution when feeling unwell.
Even with minor symptoms like a sniffle, the author chooses to modify their workout by reducing intensity and volume.
This proactive measure prevents potential setbacks in recovery.
This proactive measure avoids the risk of worsening the illness.
The text highlights the importance of considering the impact on others.
Exercising while sick can increase the likelihood of spreading germs in shared spaces like gyms.
The text emphasizes the significance of gradual progression when returning to training after a period of illness or any hiatus.
